page.title: 20TRANSPORT RAFFORD AREA
page.content: The only public transport in the area is the local bus which runs twice every day.Children are taken to school in Forres by school bus.A local man has a mini-bus in which he drives people around the area as required. As Rafford is a commuter village most people require a car to go to, Forres and other towns.We found that nearly every family had at least one car and half of the families interviewed had two cars while 4 families had 3.Of the cars we found in our survey that 36% were British while 64% were foreign.The most popular cars were Ford and Renault.The most popular colour of car was blue while the least popular colour was black. Many people have bicycles and we found that there was an average of two bicycles per house.
